summary: The Combating International Islamophobia Act aims to establish an Office within the Department of State to monitor and combat Islamophobia globally. The bill mandates the Secretary of State to appoint a Special Envoy to lead the office. It requires the inclusion of information on acts of Islamophobia in the annual country reports on human rights practices and the annual report on international religious freedom, detailing instances of violence, incitement, and government responses. The bill also calls for the Special Envoy to consult with various organizations.
